benchmark_details.name: TEET! Tunisian Dataset for Toxic Speech Detection
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a new annotated dataset composed of approximately 10,000 comments for detecting toxic speech in the Tunisian dialect, addressing the urgent need for such datasets in underrepresented languages.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To enhance the efficiency in detecting harmful and abusive content in the Tunisian dialect through a new annotated dataset.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Evaluation metrics related to inter-agreement have not been performed on the new annotated dataset.

data.source: Collected from various social media platforms using queries containing abusive keywords.
data.annotation: Annotated with a 3-way classification: Hate, Abusive, and Normal.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the predictions of various machine learning and deep learning models.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better performance in classifying toxic speech.
methodology.baseline_results: F1 Score of 92.3 for the best results in 3-way classification.
methodology.validation: Data was split into 80% for training and 20% for testing.
